description.narrative: The requested Green Climate Fund resources will enable the Government of Iraq to strengthen capacities of the newly assigned Nationally Designated Authority (NDA)

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative: Indicator 1.1.1: Number of online platforms established housing operational guidelines and supporting tools Indicator 1.1.2: Number of Monitoring and verification system for tracking financial flows developed Indicator 1.2.1: Number of national potential DAEs identified Indicator 1.2.2: Technical support activities that promote DAE effectiveness Indicator 1.3.1: Number of stakeholders’ meetings/workshops conducted Indicator 1.3.2: Number national readiness assessment completed Indicator 2,1.1: Number of project ideas for low-emission project investment incorporating innovative business model approaches Indicator 2.1.2: Number of gender issues addressed in project developer guidance Indicator 2.2.1: Number of stakeholders trained on models/tools to quantify costs/benefits of green growth technologies/practices Indicator 2.2.2: Number priority low-emission, green growth investment strategies developed Indicator 4.1.1: Number of transformative change project ideas developed

comment.narrative:
The NDA is operational but lacks necessary institutional infrastructure to take full advantage of climate finance opportunities; there are no GCF accredited entities in Iraq among national institutions; there is limited understanding among national institutions of paradigm shift and transformational change requirements and opportunities relative to low emissions and climate resilient pathways.
There are no GCF accredited entities in Iraq among national institutions
There is limited understanding of stakeholder capacity, systems and networks to support the planning, programming and implementation of GCF-funded activities
Climate finance programming has been initiated but remains in need of further development to account for strategic investment priorities, associated risks, and gender issues
Strong current emphasis on fossil fuel based energy planning among relevant institutions, coupled with limited renewable energy and energy efficiency polices and measures
There is little activity in the development of detailed project concepts

1.1 One online platforms established housing operational guidelines and supporting tools to operationalize the institutional infrastructure of the NDA to active effective coordination mechanism 1.2 One draft Monitoring and verification system for tracking financial flows established for tracking financial flows developed to support increasing understanding among national institutions of paradigm shift, transformational change requirements and opportunities. 2.1: Two national potential DAEs identified and selected with formal submission of accreditation application materials 2.2: One workshop conducted to provide technical support to the nominated DAEs effectiveness in the GCF process before submitting accreditation materials to the GCF. 3.1: Seven stakeholders’ meetings/workshops conducted to strengthen the stakeholders capacity in programming and implementation of GCF funded activities 3.2: Zero assessment of the National readiness needs conducted drafted. 4.1: A- Four of project ideas for low-emission project investment incorporating innovative business model approaches drafted B- Three gender issues addressed in project developer guidance
5.1: 25 stakeholders trained on models/tools planning to quantify costs/benefits of green growth technologies/practices to identify the five priority low-emission, green growth investment strategies or potential linkages with GCF-funded programme. 5.2: Five priority low-emission, green growth investment strategies assessed for potential linkages with GCF-funded programme. 6.1 Two draft transformative change project ideas drafted and developed.

1.1 The online platforms information is all ready for updating, the integration of the new platform is planned for Q2. 1.2 The draft of Monitoring and verification system for tracking financial flows is finalized 2.1: The MoEn to to nominate 5 DAEs in May, followed by a workshop to identify and select 2 national DAEs 2.2: One workshop to be conducted to provide technical support to the selected DAEs in May 2022 3.1: Four stakeholders workshops to be conducted in May 2022 to strengthen the stakeholders capacity in programming and implementation of GCF funded activities 3.2: Zero assessment of the National readiness needs conducted drafted. 4.1: A- Four of project ideas for low-emission project investment incorporating innovative business model approaches drafted B- Three gender issues addressed in project developer guidance during a consultative workshop in May 2022
5.1: 25 stakeholders to be trained in May on models/tools planning to quantify costs/benefits of green growth technologies/practices to identify the five priority low-emission, green growth investment strategies or potential linkages with GCF-funded programme. 5.2: Five priority low-emission, green growth investment strategies assessed for potential linkages with GCF-funded programme (in progress) 6.1 Five draft transformative change project ideas drafted, to be developed in Q2

1.1.1: One needs assessment for effective coordination mechanisms of the NDA drafted, to establish NDA platform housing operational guidelines and supporting tools 1.1.2: One draft Monitoring and verification system for tracking financial flows developed 1.2.1: One national potential DAEs identified and selected with formal submission of accreditation application materials 1.2.2: One workshop conducted to provide technical support to the nominated DAEs effectiveness in the GCF process 1.3.1: Two stakeholders’ meetings/workshops conducted to strengthen the stakeholders capacity in programming and implementation of GCF funded activities 1.3.2: One assessment of the National readiness needs conducted drafted 2.1.1: One of project ideas for low-emission project investment incorporating innovative business model approaches drafted 2.1.2: Three gender issues addressed in project developer guidance 2.2.1:15 stakeholders trained on models/tools to quantify costs/benefits of green growth technologies/practices 2.2.2: Zero draft priority low-emission, green growth investment strategies developed 4.1.1: Zero draft transformative change project ideas drafted

1.1.1: Stakeholders were consulted to identify the interface, and NDA platform requirement. Assessment completed. Ongoing work to establish and integrate the NDA platform into the MoEn website 1.1.2: 2 workshops were conducted to outline the monitoring and verification system for tracking financial flows to be developed next year 1.2.1: Stakeholders to identify 5 DAEs by 31st of Dec 2021, to be assessed using online ranking tool and select two potential DAEs to start their GCF accreditation process. 1.2.2: Due in 2022 as stakeholders delayed the nomination of 5 potential DAEs to the 31st of Dec 2021 1.3.1: Two stakeholders’ meetings/workshops were conducted in 2021, strengthening the capacity of stakeholders on programming and implementation of GCF funded activities. 1.3.2: 2 workshops were conducted to discuss and report findings on legislative/regulatory changes. assessment of the National readiness is in progress. required to promote green growth Number national readiness assessment is not started yet 2.1.1: Project ideas for low-emission project investment incorporating innovative business model approaches are identified by stakeholders during a conducted workshop 2.1.2: A workshop was conducted to identify gender issues as per stakeholders consultation 2.2.1: A workshop was conducted to train 15 stakeholders on models/tools to quantify costs/benefits of green growth technologies/practices 2.2.2: priority low-emission, green growth investment strategies has not been identified yet 4.1.1: transformative change project ideas has been identified, and being drafted
